body_html:
Hi @meteorcloudy

You are right.

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/framework/numeric_types.h#L54

#if __BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN__
    value = p[0];
#else
    value = p[1];
#endif

__BYTE_ORDER__ and __ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN__ are not predefined macros in VC++, they are defined in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/platform/windows/cpu_info.h

We should include "cpu_info.h" before using them.

    value = p[1];
#endif
__BYTE_ORDER__  and __ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN__ are not predefined macros in VC++, they are defined in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/platform/windows/cpu_info.h
We should include "cpu_info.h" before using them.
body:
Hi @meteorcloudy 

You are right.

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/framework/numeric_types.h#L54
```cpp
#if __BYTE_ORDER__ == __ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN__
    value = p[0];
#else
    value = p[1];
#endif
```

\_\_BYTE_ORDER\_\_  and \_\_ORDER_BIG_ENDIAN\_\_ are not predefined macros in VC++, they are defined in https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/core/platform/windows/cpu_info.h

We should include "cpu_info.h" before using them.
